title: Meta to nearly double its investment in AI in 2026 as Mark Zuckerberg looks to build a 'personal superintelligence'
description: In its Q4 earnings report released on Wednesday, Meta revealed that its capital expenditure on AI for 2026 would be between $115 and $135 billion, nearly twice of what the company spent on the same last year when it revamped its artificial intelligence unit.
content:
Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is looking to nearly double the company's investment in the development of artificial intelligence (AI) in 2026.
In its Q4 earnings report released on Wednesday, Meta revealed that its capital expenditure on AI for 2026 would... [802 chars]

title: Tech Titans Eye Massive Investment in OpenAI
description: Nvidia, Amazon, and Microsoft are reportedly in discussions to invest as much as $60 billion in OpenAI, a key player in artificial intelligence. The report, originating from The Information, has not yet been confirmed by Reuters.
content: In an ambitious move within the technology sector, Nvidia, Amazon, and Microsoft are reportedly contemplating a massive financial commitment to OpenAI. According to The Information's report on Wednesday, the potential investment could soar to $60 bil... [695 chars]

title: Enabled Crypto Scams Surge 500% as Fraud Goes Industrial
description: Artificial intelligence-fueled scams spiked 500% in 2025, allowing scammers to scale up fraud, according to TRM Labs in its 2026 crypto crime report.
content:
The use of large language models in scams increased fivefold in 2025, according to TRM Labs, as fraudsters leveraged the technology to boost outreach, make scams more convincing and launch them at scale.
It comes as $35 billion in cryptocurrency was ... [2989 chars]

title: ASML lifts outlook on record AI chip orders, but analysts query capacity
description: The giant chip equipment maker's orders exceeded expectations as the global chip market ramps up production capacity for the rollout of artificial intelligence and data centers.
content: ASML reported record fourth-quarter orders and raised its 2026 outlook on Wednesday, although the giant chip equipment maker faced questions from analysts about whether it had the capacity to meet surging demand from artificial intelligence chipmaker... [562 chars]

title: Microsoft pledged to save water. In the AI era, it expects water use to soar.
description: Driven by the artificial intelligence frenzy, Microsoft is internally projecting that water use at its data centers will more than double by 2030 from 2020, including in places that face shortages.
content: In 2020, Brad Smith, Microsoft’s president, outlined an ambitious plan to conserve water at the company’s growing fleet of data centres that power the internet. He pledged to cut use, support wetland restoration projects and deploy new water-saving t... [11987 chars]

title: Tony Siu's Long‑Term Path: How Research, Projects, and Community Work Shape His Approach to Building Impactful AI Systems

title: Samsung rides high on AI boom, cautions global headwinds ahead
description: "The ongoing AI boom is expected to continue driving favourable market conditions across the industry" in the first quarter of 2026, Korean giant Samsung said in a statement. This statement signifies the company's optimism, as it reported record-breaking numbers. As the race to develop artificial intelligence strains chip supply and drives up costs, Samsung Electronics reported that its operating profit more than tripled to a record high in the fourth quarter and predicted robust chip demand going forward.
content: The leading memory chipmaker in the world has tremendous pricing power, as evidenced by the results, and its profit growth is expected to pick up speed this quarter. However, the company also issued a caution for the volatility ahead as a result of f... [2985 chars]

title: Is AI behind slow hiring in the US? Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell says…
description: Noting that job gains remained slow despite the US economy being on ‘firm footing’, Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell said there was ‘some connection’ between a sluggish labour market and artificial intelligence. However, he warned against rushing towards macroeconomic conclusions.
content:
Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell on Wednesday (local time) appeared more upbeat about the US economy, saying it was on a “firm footing”, but was more equivocal about artificial intelligence (AI) and its impact on jobs and growth.

title: Survey suggests link between chatbot dependency and depression
description: People who frequently consult artificial intelligence outside work could be more prone to depressive symptoms than others, according to a team of researchers led by doctors at Massachusetts General Hospital and Weill Cornell Medical School.
content:
People who frequently consult artificial intelligence outside work could be more prone to depressive symptoms than others, according to a team of researchers led by doctors at Massachusetts General Hospital and Weill Cornell Medical School.
